newsitem.title: TURKEY: Ten foreign tourists dead in Turkish bus plunge.
newsitem.headline: Ten foreign tourists dead in Turkish bus plunge.

text.p: A coach carrying German and Dutch holidaymakers skidded off the road and plunged 30 metres (100 feet) down a ravine in southern Turkey on Thursday, killing 10 foreign tourists and a Turk, police said.
"We have been told by the travel agent's headquarters that we have nine Dutch dead, a German and a Turkish driver," a Dutch embassy spokesman said.
Nineteen people were injured in the crash near the popular Mediterranean resort of Antalya, hospital officials said.

Turkish television showed the battered bus perched awkwardly on its side part of the way down the ravine. A flattened car, apparently crushed by the bus, lay at the bottom of the gully with a corpse inside it.
The bus was carrying around 30 tourists, mostly German and Dutch, from Antalya to the inland town of Pamukkale. "It was bad weather, raining," the embassy spokesman said.
Turkey has one of the worst road traffic death rates in the world. Almost 6,000 people lost their lives in traffic accidents last year.
Seven people died on Thursday in another bus crash near the western city of Konya that was almost identical to the tourist accident, Anatolian news agency said.
A bus skidded off a wet country road and tumbled down a sharp decline. Anatolian quoted some of the 25 injured passengers as saying the driver was asleep at the time.
